page.title: 03RELIGION
page.content: Christianity is represented in this area by the Church of England and Methodism. There are small parish churches at both{East and West Torrington.}Both consist of a nave, chancel and bell- cote. Both were heavily restored in the mid-nineteenth century.{East {Torrington}contains remnants of fifteenth century windows, while{West {Torrington}has re-used masonry and a Norman font. Methodism was once strong in this area, and still has a following, though not enough to keep most of the chapels open. At{Bleasby Moor}the former chapel has been converted to a private house. In{West Torrington}one chapel is derelict, but the other is still in use, its school-room doubling as the Community Centre.
